title: Mark Moran (rugby league)
text:
Mark Moran is a former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1980s, 1990s and 2000s. He played at representative level for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a>, and at club level for <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a>, <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh</a> and <a href="Woolston%20Rovers">Woolston Rovers</a> (in <a href="Warrington">Warrington</a>), as a , or .
Playing career.
International honours.
Mark Moran won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> while at Leigh 1992 2-caps (<a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a>).
County Cup Final appearances.
Mark Moran played in <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a>'s 17-22 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="1988%20Lancashire%20Cup">1988</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1988%E2%80%9389%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1988–89 season</a> at <a href="Knowsley%20Road">Knowsley Road</a>, <a href="St%20Helens%2C%20Merseyside">St. Helens</a> on Sunday 23 October 1988.
